title: Dr Alvin Chang, MD | Internal Medicine in Santa Ana | Providence Affiliated Physicians, St. Joseph
meta_description: Dr Alvin Chang, MD is a  physician specializing in Internal Medicine, practicing medicine in Santa Ana, Tustin. Dr Alvin Chang, MD practices as a member of Providence Affiliated Physicians, St. Joseph
main_content:  Back to Search Results New Search   626150 Accepting New Patients Share Profile Alvin Chang, MD Specialty Internal Medicine Languages Spanish, Chinese - Mandarin, English Primary Address | Office Details Access Community Health Center - Santa Ana 520 North Main Street Suite 120 Santa Ana , CA 92701 Phone: (714) 352-5800 Fax: (714) 352-5801 Secondary Address | Office Details Access Community Health Center - Tustin 14642 Newport Avenue Suite 101 Tustin, CA 92780 Phone: (714) 352-5800 Fax: (714) 352-5801 Medical Groups & Affiliations Providence Affiliated Physicians, St. Joseph Get Connected to Your Provider  (714) 352-5800 The patient rating score is based on responses and comments from Press Ganey. Responses are measured on a 10 point scale, with 10 being the best score. These scores are then translated to a 5 point scale in order to display results in a 5 Star rating. Comments are also gathered from the same survey and displayed in their entirety with the exception of any language that may be considered libel, or may contain private health information, or is unrelated to the provider being reviewed. Learn more about Press Ganey star rating calculations Meet The Provider Biography The moment you step into his office, you can tell fellowship-trained geriatrician, Alvin Chang, MD, cares about seniors. "I enjoy taking care of older adults and listening to their stories. I learn so much from them. I see myself as an advocate, so I really pay attention to their concerns. I try to get to know who they are." To help those with limited mobility, Dr. Chang makes house calls to nursing homes and assisted living facilities. Dr. Chang enjoys spending time with his family. He has also served on medical missions to Mexico.
